decks.notes: The deck focuses on controlling the game by using a combination of removal spells, card draw, and powerful creatures to outvalue the opponent. It also utilizes cards that provide additional resources and flexibility, such as Castle Ardenvale and Nykthos, Shrine to Nyx. The inclusion of Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion allows for a more consistent and powerful late-game strategy with additional card advantage. Overall, the deck aims to disrupt the opponent's game plan while establishing a strong board presence and generating card advantage.

This Mono Black Control deck focuses on disruption, removal, and card advantage to control the game and outvalue the opponent. It utilizes powerful cards like Liliana of the Veil, Thoughtseize, and Fatal Push to disrupt the opponent's game plan while generating card advantage through Castle Locthwain and Graveyard Trespasser. The deck also includes threats like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse and Mutavault to close out the game efficiently. With its emphasis on resource denial and efficient removal, this deck aims to grind out the opponent and win through attrition.

The main concept of this aggro Jund deck is to utilize sacrifice synergies and deal consistent damage to the opponent through creatures like Mayhem Devil and Bloodtithe Harvester. By sacrificing creatures with Cauldron Familiar and Witch's Oven, as well as utilizing Claim the Firstborn, Deadly Dispute, and Scavenger's Talent for added value, the deck aims to control the board and overwhelm the opponent with damage output. The deck also includes versatile removal options like Fatal Push and Fable of the Mirror-Breaker to further its aggressive game plan.

The main concept of this Mono Black Control deck is to disrupt the opponent's hand with cards like Thoughtseize and Duress, while also utilizing removal spells like Fatal Push and Go for the Throat to deal with threats. The deck also aims to control the board with creatures like Graveyard Trespasser and Gifted Aetherborn. It can generate card advantage and grind out the opponent with planeswalkers like Liliana of the Veil and powerful finishers like Sheoldred, the Apocalypse. The deck's strategy revolves around resource management and outlasting the opponent through attrition.

The deck focuses on assembling the combo of Greasefang and Parhelion II to create a powerful board presence and disrupt opponent's plans through targeted removal and hand disruption. It includes various support cards like Thoughtseize, Fatal Push, and Valor's Flagship to control the game while setting up the combo pieces. The deck aims to quickly establish dominance on the battlefield and overwhelm the opponent with a combination of creature threats and removal spells.

This Dimir Control deck focuses on using Yorion, Sky Nomad as a companion to generate value by blinking permanents like Narset, Parter of Veils and Omen of the Sea. By controlling the board with cards like Fatal Push and Thoughtseize, the deck aims to maintain control of the game while setting up powerful win conditions like The Meathook Massacre and Hopeless Nightmare. The mana base is carefully crafted to support the deck's color requirements, allowing for efficient plays and consistent control over the game.

The main idea of this deck is to quickly overwhelm your opponent with low-cost, aggressive creatures while utilizing burn spells and direct damage to finish them off. The goal is to maintain a fast pace and pressure your opponent constantly, using a combination of creatures, spells, and land destruction to keep them on the back foot and unable to recover. This deck aims to win the game swiftly and decisively through efficient creature combat and burn spells.
